DataElement.preferredName: Progressive Disease or Recurrent Disease Evaluation Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date progressive disease or recurrent disease was identified, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Response Domain Progressive Disease Or Recurrent Disease Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to tumor response._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The return of a disease after a period of remission._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2021-6-8 ak 12 Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA. 11/18/18 TT released/MC.  11-19-18 TT changed max length. 11/9/18 TT changed Data Type from Character to Date and added Max Length for NCI Implementation of the standard. ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3854416 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
